summary: This is a superseding indictment from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury. The indictment details Maxwell's role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier who sexually abused minor girls, with Maxwell's assistance in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney and is listed as the foreperson.

persons.name: Minor Victim-1
persons.context: A minor victim, approximately 14 years old when met, who was groomed and sexually abused by Epstein with Maxwell's involvement in New York and Florida between 1994 and 1997.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: A minor victim under the age of 16 who was groomed by Maxwell and Epstein in New Mexico in or about 1996, including receiving an unsolicited topless massage from Maxwell.

persons.name: Minor Victim-3
persons.context: A minor victim under 18 who was groomed by Maxwell in London between 1994 and 1995, introduced to Epstein, and sexually abused by him during massages.

connections.description: Conspired together to entice and transport minor girls across state lines for the purpose of sexual abuse. Maxwell was in an intimate relationship with Epstein and was paid by him to manage properties.
Maxwell befriended, groomed, and was present for the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1 by Epstein, including participating in group sexual encounters.
Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, including providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.
Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to provide massages knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1, with Maxwell's facilitation, in New York and Florida.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 during massages in London, facilitated by Maxwell's introduction and encouragement.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse of Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, including Victims 1, 2, and 3, at various residences.

events.title: Travel of Minor Victim-1 from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided Minor Victim-2 with an unsolicited topless massage in New Mexico as part of grooming her for abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages that led to Epstein sexually abusing her.

events.title: Maxwell's Perjurious Deposition Testimony (First)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Perjurious Deposition Testimony (Second)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely denied awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and ever giving anyone a massage, including Epstein or Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minor girls across state and international lines for sexual abuse from at least 1994 to 1997.
The indictment specifies three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3), with Victim-1 being approximately 14 years old when the abuse began.
Maxwell's methods included befriending victims, normalizing sexual topics and nudity, providing or encouraging sexualized massages, and being present during abuse to put victims at ease.
Maxwell committed perjury during depositions in 2016 by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her interactions with underage girls, the presence of sex toys, and ever giving massages.
The abuse occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
